definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut

sentences.english: To celebrate, he had the cowling and struts of his fighter painted bright blue.
sentences.chinese: 慶祝，他有整流罩和他的戰士的高視闊步畫鮮豔藍色。

sentences.english: He became a Congressman at the young age of 29 and brought his frontier swagger to the Senate a year later.
sentences.chinese: 他29歲成爲議員並在一年後昂首闊步進入參議院。

sentences.english: I was strutting, I was smiling, I was bursting with energy.
sentences.chinese: 我在高視闊步，在微笑，在爆發能量。

sentences.english: The parade stalked along the highway .
sentences.chinese: 遊行隊伍沿着公路闊步前進。

sentences.english: The strut has a positive angle when the prop shaft points upwards towards the water surface.
sentences.chinese: 高視闊步有一個正面角度當支柱軸指向向上往水錶面。

sentences.english: Chuang Tzu in swords clothes strode to the court.
sentences.chinese: 莊子穿着劍服闊步地來到殿前。

sentences.english: Peacocks strut in the surrounding meadow.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀在周圍的草地上昂首闊步。

sentences.english: They swept into the hall, preceded by trumpeters.
sentences.chinese: 他們以號手爲前導昂首闊步走進大廳。

sentences.english: A poor player, That struts and frets his hour upon the stage.
sentences.chinese: 在臺上高談闊步的可憐演員。

sentences.english: He turned round about and stalked off.
sentences.chinese: 他向後一轉，昂首闊步地走開了。

sentences.english: We followed him, making great strides with head up.
sentences.chinese: 我們昂首闊步地跟着他向前走。

sentences.english: They strut and bounce, dance and flounce.
sentences.chinese: 他們昂首闊步，蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: She said, “These women stood straight and suffered fewer falls.
sentences.chinese: 她表示化妝的女性走路時昂首闊步。

sentences.english: By wearing clothes that fit you well you’ll walk taller,straighter, exude confidence and just feel great.
sentences.chinese: 穿着合身的衣服，讓你昂首闊步，流露出無比的自信。

sentences.english: We can march through only because you are leading the way ahead.
sentences.chinese: 有你在前面的披荊斬棘，纔有後面衆驢友的闊步前進。
